title: How To Unlock Caldarus Romance Option In Fields Of Mistria
description: Fields of Mistria's Caldarus romance is here at last, though getting the dragon guardian's affection takes rather a lot of work. His human form is tied to a new quest that requires several rare and valuable items, and you need to spend a lot of time in the mines before you can start it. Our Fields of Mistria Caldarus guide explains how to unlock Caldarus for romance and what his preferred gifts are.How to romance Caldarus in Fields of MistriaGood thing there's a local witch who specializes in breaking seals.Caldarus' human form and subsequent arrival on the stage of potential romance is tied to a lengthy quest introduced in Fields of Mistria's second major update, Breaking the Fire Seal. Getting to the point where you can begin the quest requires a fair bit of spelunking in the mines, as the tablet and the Fire Seal itself are buried deep in the mines, at level 60. You'll also need several emeralds, sapphires, and rubies during the quest itself, so make sure to set some aside asOnce you acquire the tablet, speak to Juniper at the bathhouse to start the quest. Once you break the seal, Caldarus will appear, adopt his human form, and expend all his energy rescuing you from the calamity that ensued after the seal broke. He's, understandably, a bit tired after that and retreats to his home in the Deep Woods to recover--but not before giving you a new spell, Dragon's Breath.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: A Knight’s Tale Is Finally Getting A 4K Blu-Ray Release
description: A Knight’s Tale 4K Steelbook $56 | Releases May 20 Preorder at Amazon Though it launched to mixed reviews in 2001, A Knight’s Tale has become something of a cult classic over the years, and soon fans can add the film to their 4K Blu-ray collection with the upcoming A Knight’s Tale 4K Steelbook edition. Preorders are now open ahead of its May 20 release, and along with a premium steelbook, it’s packed with never-before-seen features. A Knight’s Tale 4K Steelbook $56 | Releases May 20 A Knight's Tale 4K Steelbook features both a 4K and standard Blu-ray format of the film. The 4K version supports Dolby Vision HDR and Dolby Atmos surround sound. Both discs come in a gorgeous steelbook case.Though it's currently listed for $56, the price will likely drop ahead of launch. Preordering at Amazon means you won't pay until the item ships, and you'll be eligible for any price cuts between now and release. Preorder at Amazon A Knight's Tale 4K SteelbookA Knight's Tale 4K Steelbook Bonus FeaturesThis new A Knight's Tale 4K Steelbook Edition includes five never-before-seen deleted and extended scenes, an all-new gag reel, and a featurette Quill and Quarterhorse: 2nd Unit Photography. There's also some behind-the-scenes commentary and bonus content from previous releases. Note that the special features are presented in 1080p definition.5 deleted and extended scenes (New)Gag reel (New)Quill and Quarterhorse: 2nd Unit Photography (New)Commentary with director Brian Helgeland and actor Paul Bettany11 behind-the-scenes featurettes6 deleted scenesHBO Making-of SpecialMusic videoTrailers and TV adsA Knight's Tale is a comedy starring Heath Ledger, who plays a lowly squire posing as a knight to win fame and fortune. It’s a hilarious movie that's held up well over the years. This is the first time the movie will be available in 4K, though there's also a $7 standard Blu-ray version available at Amazon.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The Room studio's 80s-set paranormal VR mystery Ghost Town gets launch date
description: Fireproof Games - the studio behind eerie puzzle box adventure The Room and its equally stellar sequels - has announced a launch date for its paranormal VR mystery Ghost Town. It's coming to Meta Quest on 24th April, with a PCVR/PSVR2 release due later this year. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: Star Wars: KOTOR's troubled remake still coming, suggests studio's latest comments
description: It's been almost a year since Saber Interactive last shared an update on its long-in-the-works and reportedly troubled Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic remake. But despite the ensuing radio silence, it's now insisting, "Everything that we have talked about is still in development." Read more

author: Chelsea Stark

title: Electro Bop Boxing League is a swanky atompunk autobattler with a wonderful sense of fun
description: I don't much enjoy sports sims, but sometimes an imaginative spin on a sport will sneak past my guard. Electro Bop Boxing League has spins aplenty. You probably could have stopped at robot boxers, Developer Dob. You didn't have to give it a swaggering electro swing soundtrack as well. Special moves depicted as old-timey computer punched cards? Soldering limbs back on between rounds with a Repair-o-Gun? Little eggheads in lab coats clinging to the back of my gymrat C3PO as he pounds some would-be Megatron to shrapnel? Referee counts presented as a rebooting sequence? Developer Dob, you are spoiling us! Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: New Tides Of Annihilation trailer is a buttery montage of bossfights
description: In my hectic pursuit of a scoop, I have spent a non-zero amount of today peering at a smudgy image of a London bus sign from a Tides Of Annihilation trailer, trying to work out whether the new gooner-baiting Arthurian slasher has screwed up its portrayal of Britain’s public transport network. If it had, you’d best believe that’d be a headline. I’d have broken the internet with it. “Never mind turning the Dread Knight Mordred into a waifu,” I’d have written, hissing like a kettle. “Those absolute tourists at Eclipse Glow Games have made a mockery of the sacred N19 route from Finsbury Park to Clapham Junction.” Read more
author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 870
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Which would you rather have in your makeup collection: a nail polish that never chipped, a foundation that perfectly matched your skin tone, a long-lasting mascara that was easy to remove or a lipstick that never dried out your lips? Nail polish that never chipped! In a heartbeat. 2. How good are you at doing other people’s hair? Not great. Actually, terrible. I realized I really need to work at it when I tried to do Connor’s hair in a french braid for a dance competition, and it looked so wonky it was laughable. 3. What do you do when you’re sitting on a flight next to a stranger: chat them up or put in your headphones and pretend they’re not there? I’ll do a little polite[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 870 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 869
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Which would you rather collect: vintage clothes or vintage furniture? I could do both, but if I could only pick one, I’d have to go with vintage clothes, mostly because I don’t have a big enough house to collect furniture pieces. Sigh! Oh, and also, I don’t want to worry about my furniture being beat up by the pets and the kids playing in my house, you know? 2. How good are you with keeping secrets? If you tell me something in confidence, it’s going to the grave with me, babe; however, I do have an exception policy. If I believe someone’s in danger, then I’m gonna say something. 3. Who’s the coolest Jennifer: Jennifer Hudson, Jennifer Lopez, Jennifer Garner or Jennifer Coolidge? Jennifer Coolidge, all the[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 869 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
